description: Custody paid net cash using a 20% tax rate, while NBIM accrued at 25% (22% WHT + ~3% local), resulting in higher custody net by roughly USD 343.

evidence: NBIM NET_AMOUNT_SC: 5,181.50 USD; Custody NET_AMOUNT_SC: 5,524.27 USD; Diff: 342.77 USD
Both sides show DIV_RATE 361 KRW and NOMINAL_BASIS 25,000; Gross QC: 9,025,000 KRW
NBIM taxes: WTHTAX_RATE 22% (1,985,500 KRW) + LOCALTAX 269,550 KRW (~3%) -> NBIM NET_QC 6,769,950 KRW
Custody taxes: TAX_RATE 20%; TAX 1,805,000 KRW -> Custody NET_QC 7,220,000 KRW
Net QC gap: 450,050 KRW (~5% of gross), which drives the USD cash difference
Custody flags IS_CROSS_CURRENCY_REVERSAL = true; dates differ (NBIM Pay 20-May vs Custody Pay 25-May) but quantities match (25,000)
action_params.notes: Please confirm the correct Korean dividend withholding for KR7005930003 (Samsung Electronics) for this account. Custody appears to have applied 20% tax; NBIM accrued 22% WHT plus ~3% local (25% total). Is an additional local surtax applicable, or is a relief-at-source rate of 20% intended? Also advise if any adjustment is pending (IS_CROSS_CURRENCY_REVERSAL = true).

description: Custody calculated net cash on 12,000 shares while NBIM entitlement is 10,000; rates/tax match, so the net delta equals the extra 2,000 shares. Please correct the custody entitlement/booking.

evidence: NBIM NET_AMOUNT_SC 20,150.00 CHF vs Custody 24,180.00 CHF (diff 4,030.00 CHF)
NBIM NOMINAL_BASIS 10,000 vs Custody HOLDING_QUANTITY 12,000 (LOAN_QUANTITY 0, LENDING_PERCENTAGE 0%)
Custody NOMINAL_BASIS field shows 10,000 but amounts use 12,000 (internal inconsistency)
DIV_RATE 3.1 CHF; TAX_RATE 35% on both sides
Dates align: Ex 25-04-2025, Pay 29-04-2025; Currency CHF throughout
action_params.notes: Please confirm record-date entitlement quantity and adjust/reverse the excess 2,000-share booking so net matches 10,000 shares. LOAN_QUANTITY is 0, so lending does not explain the variance. Also clarify the separate 'Possible Restitution Amount' 4,500 CHF; if applicable, please advise via a separate instruction.
